newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee softens in slack trade.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee softens in slack trade.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee closed slightly lower in range trade, but the focus was on call money which fell early and showed signs of rising again, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 56.62 to the dollar, after opening at 56.60. The currency closed at 56.57 on Wednesday.
"There was very little activity in the forex market, but call money movements were very surprising," said an American Express Bank dealer.
Although call money closed sharply lower at the repo rate of 13.25 percent after falling from 22, Friday money was sold at 22 percent, he said.
"Some banks want to maintain call money at artificially high levels because they have generated rupees through swaps, and short-term borrowings, at very high rates," said the Amex dealer.
